Title: The Federal Civilian Workforce Over Time
Variables: Department, Agency, Subagency, Fiscal Year (range)
Example Questions: How has the total federal workforce size changed over the past decade? What is the trend in employee count for a specific agency?

Title: Federal Workforce by Agency and Occupation
Variables: Department, Agency, Subagency, Occupational Series
Example Questions: Which agencies employ the most IT specialists? How does workforce distribution vary across different occupational series?

Title: Federal Workforce by Appointment Type
Variables: Department, Agency, Subagency, Service Type (Competitive/Excepted), Permanent/Temporary status
Example Questions: What percentage of federal employees are in permanent vs. temporary positions? Which agencies rely most heavily on non-permanent staff?

Title: Federal Workforce by Bargaining Unit Status
Variables: Department, Agency, Subagency, Bargaining Unit Eligibility, Date Range (month/year)
Example Questions: What proportion of employees are union-eligible but not in a bargaining unit? How has bargaining unit membership trended over time?

Title: Federal Workforce Changes Over Time
Variables: Department, Agency, Subagency, Fiscal Year (range)
Example Questions: What is the net change in federal employment year over year? During which fiscal years did the workforce grow or shrink the most?

Title: Federal Workforce Changes by Agency
Variables: Department, Agency, Subagency, Fiscal Year (range)
Example Questions: Which agencies experienced the largest workforce changes? How do workforce changes compare across departments?

Title: Separations and Accessions Since January 20, 2025
Variables: Department, Agency, Subagency, Occupational Series, Separation/Accession Action Types
Example Questions: What is the net hiring vs. separation balance since the new administration? Which occupational series have seen the most separations?

Title: Separations and Accessions Over Time
Variables: Department, Agency, Subagency, Personnel Action Type, Specific Action (e.g., New Hire), Fiscal Year
Example Questions: What are the historical trends in new hires vs. retirements? When do agencies typically see the highest turnover?

Title: Federal Workforce by Pay Plan and Grade
Variables: Department, Agency, Subagency, Fiscal Year
Example Questions: What is the distribution of employees across GS grades? How does pay grade composition differ by agency?

Title: Salary Distribution by Agency and Series
Variables: Department, Agency, Subagency, Occupational Series, Fiscal Year
Example Questions: What is the average salary for a specific occupational series? Which agencies pay the highest salaries for comparable positions?

Title: Performance Ratings Distribution
Variables: Department, Agency, Rating Pattern (e.g., Pattern H, Pattern A), Fiscal Year
Example Questions: What percentage of employees receive the highest performance ratings? How do performance ratings vary across departments?

Title: Use of Administrative Leave
Variables: Department, Administrative Leave Type, Pay Period Date Range
Example Questions: How much administrative leave is being used for investigations? What are the trends in administrative leave usage over time?

Title: Current Job Announcements by Agency
Variables: Department, Agency, Subagency, Occupational Series, Hiring Path
Example Questions: Which agencies currently have the most open positions? What types of jobs are federal agencies actively recruiting for?

Title: Current Job Announcements by Location
Variables: Department, Agency, Subagency, Occupational Series, Hiring Path, Location
Example Questions: Where are federal jobs currently available geographically? Which regions have the most federal hiring opportunities?

Title: Job Announcements Over Time
Variables: Department, Agency, Subagency, Occupational Series, Hiring Path, Fiscal Year Range
Example Questions: How has federal hiring activity changed over time? Is the government expanding or contracting recruitment efforts?

Title: Employees by Age
Variables: Department, Agency, Subagency, Age Groups
Example Questions: What is the age distribution of the federal workforce? Which agencies have the youngest or oldest workforce?

Title: Employees by Retirement Eligibility
Variables: Department, Agency, Subagency, Occupational Series, Eligibility Timeframe (now vs. 10 years)
Example Questions: What percentage of employees are currently eligible to retire? How many employees will become retirement-eligible in the next decade?

Title: Employees by Veteran Status
Variables: Department, Agency, Subagency, Veteran Status Categories
Example Questions: What proportion of federal employees are veterans? Which agencies have the highest veteran employment rates?

Title: Employees by Education Level
Variables: Department, Agency, Subagency, Occupational Series, Education Level
Example Questions: What is the educational attainment profile of the federal workforce? Which occupations require the highest education levels?

Title: Distribution of Employees by Location
Variables: Department, Agency, Subagency
Example Questions: Where are federal employees located geographically? What is the concentration of federal workers by state?

Title: Location by Agency and State
Variables: Department, Agency, Subagency, State, Fiscal Year
Example Questions: Which states have the largest presence of a specific agency? How has geographic distribution of employees changed over time?

Title: Telework and Remote Work Over Time
Variables: Department, Hours Type (e.g., Situational Telework), Pay Period Date Range
Example Questions: How have telework patterns changed since return-to-office directives? What percentage of work hours are performed remotely?
